result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Tillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--comply with ALL family court orders regarding Child Support

--make all child support payments ON TIME

--make all payments on arrearages as required by Child Support orders

--within 5 days of sentencing (or, if confined, within 5 days of business days of release from custody), shall report to the child support agency Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 South Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219 to complete case management meeting 

--advise Child Support Office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change

--not to leave Wisconsin without court approval

--All Payments toward child support and arrearages to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, Box 74200 Milwaukee, WI 53274-0200 NOT through DOC

Arresting Agency: Jefferson County Child Support Services

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: DOC balance inquiry screen print

[MA]Case called at 10:43am
Defendant Robert E Tillman in court, in custody with attorney Richard S Burris.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Mr. Tillman  to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith and be consecutive to any sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  139  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain and maintain employment 
--comply with ALL family court orders regarding Child Support
--make all child support payments ON TIME
--make all payments on arrearages as required by Child Support orders
-- within 5 days of business days of release from custody, shall report to the child support agency Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 South Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219 to complete case management meeting 
--advise the Jefferson County Child Support Office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--not to leave Wisconsin without court approval
--All Payments toward child support and arrearages to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, Box 74200 Milwaukee, WI 53274-0200 NOT through DOC

The Court reduces any outstanding costs and fees to civil judgment 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:02am
Attorney Burris
Transcript of 11/8/16 Plea and Sentencing Hearing
w/ revocation summary

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:19pm [ma]
Defendant Robert E Tillman in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits victim impact statement 

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--comply with ALL family court orders regarding Child Support
--make all child support payments ON TIME
--make all payments on arrearages as required by Child Support orders
--within 5 days of sentencing (or, if confined, within 5 days of business days of release from custody), shall report to the child support agency Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 South Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219 to complete case management meeting 
--advise Child Support Office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--not to leave Wisconsin without court approval
--All Payments toward child support and arrearages to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, Box 74200 Milwaukee, WI 53274-0200 NOT through DOC
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay $318.50 in extradition fees 


Days credit for time already served:  60  days
recess: 3:34pm
State's
Defendant's

Case called at 8:44am [ma]
Defendant Robert E Tillman in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa on behalf of the  Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Mr.Tillman   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--demand for speedy trial
recess: 8:50am

Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:33 pm [sf]
Defendant Robert E Tillman in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney  Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel).  Melanie Susan Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Defendant advises his DOB is 9/5/1985. New Address information provided.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 CASH  bond, with no special conditions.

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit. Requested by the Defense (State waived).
